basics.name: Madhusudan Agarwal
basics.summary: Software Engineer with experience in distributed systems, machine learning, and backend development. Passionate about building scalable infrastructure and intelligent systems.

work.summary: Built and maintained scalable microservices for an e-commerce serving 1M+ requests/month. Led improvements in security, testing, and access control.
highlights: Handled 1M+ monthly requests using Java (Spring Boot) and Amazon SQS
Reduced bug reports by 15% via rigorous unit testing using JUnit.
Integrated Keycloak for internal access control and RBAC.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to meet latency targets and ensure system reliability.
Tech stack: Java, Spring Boot, SQS, MySQL, MongoDB, AWS, JUnit, Keycloak

Reduced UI bugs by 40% during QA cycles, improving release confidence.

work.summary: Optimized backend services and streamlined manual workflows.
highlights: Improved filtering speed by 20% in Golang backend via query optimization.

projects.name: Trajectory Prediction
projects.description: Built a Social LSTM model on Argoverse 2 to predict trajectories of road agents in urban scenarios.
highlights: Designed LSTM with social attention for multi-agent interaction over 11s sequences.
Boosted accuracy 15% over baselines using feature augmentation and ego normalization.
Achieved validation MSE 7.7383 and MAE 1.2879.
Handled rare events and complex motion for stable autonomous planning.
Tech stack: Python, PyTorch, NumPy, LSTM

projects.name: CUDA Matrix Multiplication
projects.description: High-performance GEMM kernels optimized for NVIDIA GPUs (CUDA) and ARM CPUs (SVE).
highlights: CUDA kernel used shared memory, register blocking, and memory coalescing for 30× speedup over naive.
ARM SVE microkernel used vectorization and cache blocking for 3× speedup.
Achieved 3535 GFLOPS on NVIDIA T4 and 19.3 GFLOPS on ARM C7g.medium.
Automated tuning and edge-case handling improved performance and robustness.
